result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion and Order for Withdrawal of Counsel
Telephone conference on May 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant John P Emond appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Greg Venturini for John P Emond appeared in court. 

Atty Venturini requests a status conference. Defendant will have an ATR on another case.

records.addlTxt:
03:04 PM Defendant John P Emond in court, in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions regarding non-representation.  Defendant will contact the public defender office.  Officer Matt Scheppler is sworn and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence for a welfare check. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to observing the defendant's demeanor.  Testifies to items found on defendant's person.  Testifies to a test result of positive of fentanayl.  

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $2500
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol or drugs. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

01:40 PM Defendant John P Emond in court, in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John P Emond appeared by video means.
Transferred to Branch 1 for preliminary hearing.
